intro: Scrophularia sardashtensis, commonly known as Sardasht valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes a variety of herbs and flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a tubular shape that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scrophularia sardashtensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
